awd_titl_txt: Electron Diffraction and Imaging of Crystal Defects and     Surfaces
awd_abstract_narration: This research is for the development of advanced electron                       microscopy techniques and their use in material science. Specific               techniques of interest are in-line holography in a scanning                     transmission electron microscope (STEM) and high-angle annular                  dark-field (HAADF) STEM imaging. In-line holography promises to be              a feasible means to enhance STEM resolution without the requirement             of higher accelerating voltage. HAADF imaging will be well suited               to study crystal defects and surface layers. In particular, the                 above techniques will be applied to studying ferroelectric domain               structures in thin crystals of barium titanate. The results of this             research are expected to have a major impact on our ability to                  characterize technologically important material systems.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
